Description:
Detects a renamed Powershell execution, which is a common technique used to circumvent security controls and bypass detection logic that's dependent on process names and process paths.


Author: Harish Segar, frack113
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Renamed Powershell Under Powershell Channel
Query: sourcetype like 'windows-%' eql select * from _source_ where (data like '%hostname=consolehost%' and  not ((data like '%hostapplication=powershell%' or data like '%hostapplication=c:\windows\system32\windowspowershell\v1.0\powershell%' or data like '%hostapplication=c:\windows\syswow64\windowspowershell\v1.0\powershell%' or data like '%hostapplication=c:/windows/system32/windowspowershell/v1.0/powershell%' or data like '%hostapplication=c:/windows/syswow64/windowspowershell/v1.0/powershell%') or data re 'HostId=[a-zA-Z0-9-]{36}\s+EngineVersion='))
